headline.main: As The Palaces Burn (60 Second Trailer)
ACLU: Two-Thirds of New Kansas Voter Registrations on Hold
headline.print_headline: ACLU: Two-Thirds of New Kansas Voter Registrations on Hold

docs.snippet: Voting rolls in Kansas are in "chaos" because of the state's proof-of-citizenship requirements, the American Civil Liberties Union has argued in a court document, noting that about two-thirds of new voter registration applications submitted during...
docs.lead_paragraph: Voting rolls in Kansas are in "chaos" because of the state's proof-of-citizenship requirements, the American Civil Liberties Union has argued in a court document, noting that about two-thirds of new voter registration applications submitted during a three-week period in February are on hold.

headline.main: Muhammad Salah, Acquitted of Supporting Hamas, Dead at 62

headline.main: Tiger Registers for U.S. Open but Return Date Still Unknown
headline.print_headline: Tiger Registers for U.S. Open but Return Date Still Unknown

docs.snippet: Tiger Woods has registered to play in June's U.S. Open at Oakmont Country Club in Pennsylvania but has not set a timetable for his return to the PGA Tour....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tiger Woods has registered to play in June's U.S. Open at Oakmont Country Club in Pennsylvania but has not set a timetable for his return to the PGA Tour.

headline.main: For Most in Women’s Soccer, Hashtags Don’t Pay the Bills
headline.print_headline: For Equal Sway, Fans Are Vital

docs.snippet: The National Women’s Soccer League, which just entered its fourth season, is making progress. But only increased fan support will ensure its survival....
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column underscores huge wage discrepancy between women and men professional soccer players, noting National Women's Soccer League cannot afford to pay players much and needs support of fans, in form of ticket and merchandise sales, to gain strength.
docs.lead_paragraph: The National Women’s Soccer League, which just entered its fourth season, is making progress. But only increased fan support will ensure its survival.

headline.main: Oklahoma Bill Tying Abortions to Doctor Licenses Criticized
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Bill Tying Abortions to Doctor Licenses Criticized

docs.snippet: Of the pieces of anti-abortion legislation that Oklahoma lawmakers have considered this session, one that would strip doctors of their license to practice has abortion rights activists and the state's medical association balking....
docs.lead_paragraph: Of the pieces of anti-abortion legislation that Oklahoma lawmakers have considered this session, one that would strip doctors of their license to practice has abortion rights activists and the state's medical association balking.

headline.main: Parents of Missing Mexican Students Slam Government Probe
headline.print_headline: Parents of Missing Mexican Students Slam Government Probe

docs.snippet: The parents of 43 missing students who disappeared in September 2014 accused Mexico's government on Monday of lying to them, planting evidence and not adequately investigating the case....
docs.lead_paragraph: The parents of 43 missing students who disappeared in September 2014 accused Mexico's government on Monday of lying to them, planting evidence and not adequately investigating the case.

headline.main: 2nd Security Firm Raises Concerns About Cruz and Kasich Apps
headline.print_headline: 2nd Security Firm Raises Concerns About Cruz and Kasich Apps

docs.snippet: Another computer-security firm raised concerns Monday about the potential for hackers to glean users' personal data from phone apps released by the campaigns of Republican presidential contenders Ted Cruz and John Kasich....
docs.lead_paragraph: Another computer-security firm raised concerns Monday about the potential for hackers to glean users' personal data from phone apps released by the campaigns of Republican presidential contenders Ted Cruz and John Kasich.
